title: Agent Fox Mulder
gameEffect: [RP]s generated by Agent Mulder must be used to purchase cards. Place three tokens on this card. Discard a token to play a Site for zero [RP] cost.
bio: Agent Fox Mulder often applies farfetched theories to unexplained phenomena, much to the chagrin of his FBI peers. Mulder experiences a crisis of faith after evidence suggests that alien phenomena is nothing but a government hoax, compelling him to jeopardize the X - Files unit when he learns of a boy bearing genetic proof of human/alien hybridization.

title: Agent Dana Scully
gameEffect: Place three tokens on this card. Discard a token to examine any one Bluff card. Place Bluff card back on Site after examining.
bio: While science and logic have long been her guiding values, Dana Scully must re - evaluate her life when a child is revealed to be her biological daughter. After nearly perishing in an attack by alien rebels, she questions her disbelief in extraterrestrial phenomena and must convince a disillusioned Mulder to do so as well.

title: Sheriff Lucius Hartwell (Scully's POV)
gameEffect: If Hartwell is in the same Team as Agent Scully, he gains +1 to his BEHAVIORAL and SCIENCES skills. Place one token on this card. Discard a token to negate any one combat attack directed at Agent Scully.
bio: Lucius Hartwell is a competent, handsome vampire who served as Sheriff to the residents of Chaney, Texas. He assisted Agents Mulder and Scully in their investigation into the fatal bloodlettings of several tourists.

title: Sheriff Lucius Hartwell (Mulder's POV)
gameEffect: If Hartwell is in the same Team as Agent Mulder, he gains +1 to his BUREAUCRACY and OCCULT INVESTIGATION skills. Place one token on this card. Discard a token at any time to play one Keyword OCCULT card for zero cost.
bio: Lucius Hartwell is a doltish, bucktoothed vampire who served as Sheriff to the residents of Chaney, Texas. He assisted Agents Mulder and Scully in their investigation into the fatal bloodlettings of several tourists.

title: Agent Fox Mulder
gameEffect: [RP]s generated by Agent Mulder must be used to purchase cards. Place three tokens on this card. Discard a token to play a Site for zero [RP] cost.
bio: Agent Fox Mulder often applies farfetched theories to unexplained phenomena, much to the chagrin of his FBI peers. Mulder experiences a crisis of faith after evidence suggests that alien phenomena is nothing but a government hoax, compelling him to jeopardize the X - Files unit when he learns of a boy bearing genetic proof of human/alien hybridization.

title: Agent Dana Scully
gameEffect: Place three tokens on this card. Discard a token to examine any one Bluff card. Place Bluff card back on Site after examining.
bio: While science and logic have long been her guiding values, Dana Scully must re - evaluate her life when a child is revealed to be her biological daughter. After nearly perishing in an attack by alien rebels, she questions her disbelief in extraterrestrial phenomena and must convince a disillusioned Mulder to do so as well.

title: John Fitzgerald Byers
gameEffect: Once per turn, Byers adds 1 to a COMPUTER skill check that is occurring at another Site.
bio: Born on November 22, 1963, and named after the 35th President, John Byers was a public relations worker for the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) before joining the Lone Gunmen. He is an idealist and has a working knowledge of medicine, genetics, and chemistry.

title: Melvin Frohike
gameEffect: Place one token on this card. Remove a token to negate one Event card played on your Team.
bio: Melvin Frohike is a computer hacker with a counterculture ethos. Prior to joining the Lone Gunmen, Frohike was an acclaimed tango dancer in Miami, Florida. He toured the country with hippies before founding the Frohike Electronics Corp., specializing in cable pirating hardware. As the watchdog group's "man of action", Frohike occasionally resorts to intense stunts and undercover surveillance.

title: Richard "Ringo" Langly
gameEffect: Place one token on this card. Remove a token to discard one Bluff attached to a Site.
bio: Born in Saltville, Nebraska, Richard Langly showed an aptitude for computers from an early age. Recognizable by his long hair, black - rimmed glasses, and heavy metal T - shirts, Langly's hacking skills surpass those of his fellow Lone Gunmen. Langly once claimed to have had breakfast with the man who shot President John F. Kennedy.

title: Holly Patton
gameEffect: While Holly Patton is in the Bureau section, Keyword GOVERNMENT Equipment may be requisitioned for -2[RP] cost. Patton may use MARTIAL ARTS cards.
bio: Holly Patton worked in the FBI's Computer Records Office when she inexplicably assaulted A.D. Walter Skinner at the behest of serial murderer Robert Patrick Modell (a.k.a. "Pusher"). After Patton transferred to the FBI Communication Center, Agent Scully sought her help in tracking a mole within the Bureau.

title: Agent Michael Kinsley
gameEffect: Place 1 [RP] on this card. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword MOVE or TRAINING cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
bio: Agent Kinsley and his FBI partner, Carla Stonecypher, became inadvertently involved in the investigation of Michael Asekoff's disappearance. Kinsley credits his positive disposition to teamwork seminars, one of which involved building towers out of office furniture.

title: Agent Carla Stonecypher
gameEffect: Treat Agent Stonecypher as a RES 2 if she is in the same section of the table as Agent Michael Kinsley.
bio: Agent Stonecypher and her FBI partner, Michael Kinsley, became inadvertently involved in the investigation of Michael Asekoff's disappearance while accompanying Agents Mulder and Scully to a team - building seminar.

title: Detective John Kresge
gameEffect: If Kresge is in the same Team as Agent Scully, he gains +1 to his SCIENCES and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills.
bio: John Kresge is a San Diego homicide detective who investigated the death of Roberta Sim. Despite his initial annoyance at Agent Scully's involvement in the case, Kresge came to appreciate her insight.

title: Capt. Jack Bonsaint
gameEffect: If Bonsaint is in the same Team as Agent Scully, he gains +2 to his OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill and Bonsaint's Keyword SKEPTIC is changed to BELIEVER.
bio: As Captain of the Amma Beach Police Department in Maine, Jack Bonsaint investigated a bizarre series of self - inflicted injuries that plagued the seaside community. He worked alongside Agent Dana Scully, who happened to be in town on vacation.

title: Detective Lloyd Pennock
gameEffect: Place two tokens on this card. Remove a token to search your Bureau Deck and add one Keyword OBSERVATION card to your hand. Reshuffle your Bureau Deck.
bio: Lloyd Pennock is a homicide detective with the Wilmington Police Department who investigated the fatal stabbing of Paco Ordóñez. Pennock enlisted Mulder and Scully on the case, believing that the prime suspect, Marty Glenn, possessed extrasensory abilities.

title: Agent Rice
gameEffect: Place one token on this card. Discard a token to negate one PAWN Adversary. Agent Rice may use MARTIAL ARTS cards.
bio: Agent Rice worked out of the FBI Field Office in Chicago, and led the S.W.A.T. team tasked with resolving the hostage situation at the VinylRight telemarketing office. Rice later described Agent Mulder's behavior as erratic to his superiors in Washington, D.C.

title: Mighty Men
gameText: Damage from LONG RANGE COMBAT may be split among all Agents with the Keyword FBI.
dialogue: "All members to worship. The Lord shall preserve you from all your evils. He shall preserve your soul." - Mighty Man

title: Primitive Culling
gameText: The LRC round is skipped. This Adversary will attack the strongest Agent first, the strongest Agent having the highest sum of X (X = current LRC+CRC+HEALTH+OBSERVATION). If two or more Agents share the highest sum, choose randomly among them. This Adversary may use SUBTERFUGE cards.
dialogue:
"They divided us so they could go after her. Michele was in the lead and
presumably the strongest. They take the strongest first." - Mulder

title: Stiletto for Hire
gameText: Each source of damage affecting this Adversary in CLOSE RANGE COMBAT also causes 1 damage to each opposing Agent involved in the Combat (because they have poisonous blood). Damage caused by this Adversary may be split among two opponents (Directed Player's choice). This Adversary may use SUBTERFUGE Combat cards.
dialogue:
Dr. Calderon: "What do you want me to tell him?"
Dark - Suited Man #1: "Nothing."

title: Fox Huntress
gameText: One Agent (your choice) will attack their fellow Agents in conjunction with this Adversary. When the Huntress's HEALTH is reduced to zero, the "pushed" Agent is immediately sent to the Hospital regardless of HEALTH and may not leave until fully healed. The cost to play this card is 4[CP] if "Pusher" is in your Discard Pile.
dialogue: "You think you can hold me?" - Linda Bowman, her dying words

title: Psycho-Therapist
gameText: The LONG RANGE COMBAT round is skipped. All Agents are immobilized by tree roots and unable to use Combat cards. Agents must use their BEHAVIORAL skill as their value in CLOSE RANGE COMBAT. If an Agent has no BEHAVIORAL skill, their value is 1.
dialogue:
Mulder: "She made you believe you were a victim but you weren't, were you?"
Bobby Rich: "She said I have the power to - to make it all go away."

title: Chinga's Play
gameText: This card does not initiate Combat. Each Agent on the Team inflicts X damage upon themselves. X = the Agent's CLOSE RANGE COMBAT value.
dialogue: "Let's have fun!" - Chinga, the Evil Doll

title: Urschleim Goes Viral
gameText: This Adversary will attack for one round of LONG RANGE COMBAT and is discarded. Urschleim only targets Agents with either a COMPUTER skill, a "Cellular Phone", or an ELECTRICAL Equipment card. Any Witnesses contributing to a COMPUTER skill check are discarded. Damage caused by this Adversary may be split among multiple opponents (Directed Player's choice).
dialogue: Scully: "Urschleim in silicon?" Esther Nairn: "The primordial slime. The ooze out of which all life evolved. Except this time it's artificial slime - artificial life."

title: Gnaw of the Vampire
gameText: The Vampire is unaffected by LONG RANGE COMBAT attacks. One opposing Agent (your choice) is immediately incapacitated and unable to participate in the Combat until the second round of CLOSE RANGE COMBAT.
dialogue: "I think maybe you were right before when you said that this is just a guy who's watched too many Dracula movies. He just happens to be a real vampire." - Mulder

title: The Rebels Strike
gameText: This card is free if played on a Keyword ABDUCTEE card. Damage from CLOSE RANGE COMBAT may be split among all opponents (Directed Player's choice).
dialogue: "An alien rebel. This is what the boy saw in Russia. The last face the dead saw at Skyland Mountain, and most surely who killed our man at the dam in Pennsylvania." - The Well - Manicured Man

title: Charles Wesley Gotts
gameText: Unless the opposing Team makes an OBSERVATION 4+ skill check, this Adversary will attack in the CRC round regardless of how much LRC damage is inflicted. This Adversary may use SUBTERFUGE Combat cards.
dialogue: "Charles Wesley Gotts, an ex - con. Convicted in 1970 of aggravated assault. He was paroled three weeks ago and he's been missing ever since." - Mulder

title: Prince of Darkness
gameText: Agents must use their SUBTERFUGE skill as their value in LRC and CRC. If an Agent has no SUBTERFUGE skill, their value is 1. This Adversary may use SUBTERFUGE Combat cards. This card is free if played on a Site at which "The Fallen Ones" was successfully played.
dialogue: "The others were taken from me. I will not allow that to happen again." - Aaron Starkey

title: The Skin-Head Man
gameText: The Skin-Head Man may use MARTIAL ARTS and SUBTERFUGE Combat cards. During the CLOSE RANGE COMBAT round, this Adversary will negate up to two points of damage from any one source (your choice).
dialogue: "If I set you up, you think I'd even get into the car with this Nazi piece of shi - !" - Mulder

title: Unnatural Prowler
gameText: This Adversary may attack by itself or select one Agent with an OBSERVATION skill to attack the remaining Team in conjunction with this Creature. Combat is resolved when the Creature's HEALTH is reduced to zero. The target Agent must go to the Hospital regardless of HEALTH and remain there until fully healed. In addition, the Agent is afflicted with the Keyword INSANITY until a HEALING card is played them. The Prowler may use SUBTERFUGE cards.
dialogue: "What if such a creature existed that could camouflage itself by clouding the minds of its victims?." - Mulder

title: Agent Cameron Hill
gameText: Adds 1 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL or SUBTERFUGE skill check, or return one PRIMORDIAL Adversary that is played on your team to the bottom of the owning player's Bureau Deck.
dialogue:
Scully: "He's heading towards the sound booth."
Agent Cameron Hill: "Copy that. I'm cutting him off."

title: Michael Kritschgau
gameText: Attach this Witness to one Keyword FBI Agent. Adds 1 to the Agent's RES. Discard this card when the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to zero. Each player may only have one of this card in their decks.
dialogue: "The U.S. Military saw a good thing in '47 when the Roswell story broke. The more we denied it, the more people thought it was true: aliens had landed." - Michael Kritschgau

title: Dr. Zuckerman
gameText: Place this Witness in the Hospital. Once per turn, during your Healing Phase, use this card to gain one of the following effects: heal one additional point of damage, remove one game effect token, or remove an afflicted Keyword (e.g. CANCER, INSANITY) from an Agent in the Hospital.
dialogue: "I'm going after your cancer as aggressively as I know how, Dana." - Dr. Zuckerman

title: Susanne Modeski
gameText: Attach this Witness to any one Keyword WATCHDOG Agent. Once per turn, the Agent may use their COMPUTER skill as their value in LONG RANGE COMBAT. Discard this card when the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to zero or to negate one Keyword INSANITY card.
dialogue: "No matter how paranoid you are, you're not paranoid enough." - Susanne Modeski

title: Louis Asekoff
gameText: Adds 1 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL or COMPUTER skill check, or play this card to return "Primitive Culling" to the bottom of the owning player's Bureau Deck.
dialogue:
Louis Asekoff: "Dad, what's that?
Mr. Asekoff: "Surveyor's equipment. Someone left his stuff out here."

title: Michele Fazekas
gameText: Attach this Witness to a Team. Michele Fazekas will add her skills to the appropriate skill check like an Agent, OBS:2, CRC:1, LRC:1, and HEALTH:3. If her HEALTH is reduced to zero, or at any time there are no Agents in the Team, remove Fazekas from the game.
dialogue: "I followed good tracks for the two surveyors but the trails became confused as they moved into the brush." - Michele Fazekas

title: Jeff Glaser
gameText: Attach this Witness to a Team in the Field. Discard this resource to enable the Team to apply their LONG RANGE COMBAT value to any Adversary in which the LRC round is skipped. This card is removed from the game if at any time there are no Agents remaining on the Team.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Where is it?"
Jeff Glaser: "It's about forty yards ahead of you."

title: Shaineh Berkowitz
gameText: Place three tokens on this card. Discard a token to add 2 to one Team's EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill check. You may discard a token once per turn. Discard this Resource when all tokens have been removed. While this card is in play, the Witness card "Izzy Berkowitz" may be played for free.
dialogue: "They said on 'Jerry Springer' you're, like, an expert." - Shaineh Berkowitz

title: Izzy Berkowitz
gameText: Adds 2 to one Team's OBSERVATION or SUBTERFUGE skill check, or play this card during your Requisition Phase to attach the "Tape Recorder" to an Agent in the Field at no cost.
dialogue:
Scully: "We have reason to believe that you or one of your friends recorded our conversation last night and gave it to a newspaper reporter."
Izzy: "Me?"

title: Elizabeth Pollidori
gameText: Adds 2 to one Team's EVIDENCE COLLECTION or SCIENCES skill check, or play this card to negate the Bluff "Mad Scientist".
dialogue:
Elizabeth Pollidori: "We were going to have that talk."
Dr. Pollidori: "Soon, soon. We'll have our talk soon."
Elizabeth: "That's what you always say."

title: Tara Scully
gameText: Play this card to add one game effect token to Agent Dana Scully. This token is usable in the same way as the Agent's three starting tokens.
dialogue: "I can't believe I'm going to say this. As big and fat as I am right now, I can't wait to have more. This is our baby, our son. It kind of gives everything new meaning." - Tara Scully

title: Susan Chambliss
gameText: Adds X to one Team's BEHAVIORAL or BUREAUCRACY skill check. X = 1 for every 2 [RP] paid when playing this card.
dialogue: "I presented all this information to the court. I have to tell you that they are greatly concerned that you are making decisions for this child." - Susan Chambliss

title: Dr. William Vinet
gameText: Adds X to one Team's MEDICAL or SCIENCES skill check. X = 1 for every 2 [RP] paid when playing this card.
dialogue: "We've put her on a saline drip to rehydrate her. She's running a fever of about 102. It's a good thing you got her here when you did." - Dr. William Vinet

title: Anna Fugazzi
gameText: Adds X to one Team's ALIEN INVESTIGATION or EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill check. X = 1 for every 2 [RP] paid when playing this card.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Is that your real name?"
Fugazzi: "Yes, for the last 71 years. Were you looking for me?"
Mulder: "Not until now."

title: Patti Rich
gameText: Adds 2 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL or OBSERVATION skill check. While this card is in play, the Witness "Bobby Rich" may be played for free.
dialogue:
Patti Rich: "Phil was late coming home. He'd been stressed out ‘cuz of the blight and stuff."
Scully: "What do you mean?"
Patti: "His nut trees all got a disease."

title: Lisa Baiocchi
gameText: Adds 2 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL or SUBTERFUGE skill check. This Witness may modify a Team's skill check once during Combat, if applicable.
dialogue:
Lisa Baiocchi: "What are you doing here?"
Bobby Rich: "I - I called you last night. I mean, how come you didn't call me back?"
Lisa: "They're saying you killed him, Bobby."

title: Bobby Rich
gameText: Adds 3 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL or adds 2 to one Team's SUBTERFUGE skill check. This Witness may modify a Team's skill check once during Combat, if applicable.
dialogue:
Mulder: "He says he's innocent."
Scully: "What do you think?"
Mulder: "I think he's a tough kid to love."

title: John Ramirez, The Orchard Man
gameText: Adds 1 to one Team's SUBTERFUGE or OBSERVATION skill check, or play this card to negate the Adversary "Psycho-Therapist."
dialogue:
Orchard Man: "Twenty years ago this happens."
Mulder: "What causes this?"
Orchard Man: "A very bad man."

title: Melissa Turner
gameText: Place three tokens on this card. Discard a token to add 2 to one Team's SUBTERFUGE skill check. You may discard a token once per turn. Discard this Resource when all tokens have been removed.
dialogue: "I saw Dave dead. Before he was dead. I saw him in frozen foods all cut and bloody, and it's not the first time." - Melissa Turner

title: Esther Nairn, a.k.a. Invisigoth
gameText: Place three tokens on this card. Discard a token to add 2 to one Team's COMPUTER skill check. You may discard a token once per turn. Discard this Resource when all tokens have been removed. This Witness may modify a Team's skill check once during Combat, if applicable.
dialogue: "Are these the brain donors that nearly got us incinerated?" - Esther Nairn

title: Dr. Heitz Werber
gameText: Place two tokens on this card. Once per turn, remove a token to select one [RP] card from your Discard Pile and add it to your hand. If the chosen card has the Keyword ALIEN INVESTIGATION or BEHAVIORAL, the cost to play it is reduced by 1 [RP]. Discard this card when the last token is removed.
dialogue: "I've taken a lot of criticism for my work with alien abductees, and in the field itself." - Dr. Heitz Werber

title: Dorothy Bahnsen
gameText: Adds 1 to one Team's BUREAUCRACY skill check once per turn, or play this card to negate one Keyword TRAITOR card.
dialogue:
Arthur Dales: "An X - File?"
Dorothy Bahnsen: "Yes, unsolved cases. I file them under 'X'."
Dales: "Why don't you file them under 'U' for 'Unsolved'?"
Bahnsen: "That's what I did until I ran out of room. Plenty of room in the 'X's."

title: Marty Glenn
gameText: Adds X to one Team's OBSERVATION or CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill check. X = 1 for every 2 [RP] paid when playing this card. Alternately, you may play this card for 2 [RP] to negate the Adversary "Charles Wesley Gotts."
dialogue: "Read the confession. I got it all perfect. Every detail. How could I do that if I'm innocent?" - Marty Glenn

title: A.D.A. Dan Costa
gameText: Adds 2 to one Team's BUREAUCRACY or CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill check. The cost of this card is reduced by one [RP] if played on a Team that includes Detective Pennock.
dialogue:
Dan Costa: "Well, I'm not going to try to indict a blind girl on some lousy prints."
Mulder: "She doesn't exactly fit the definition 'blind girl'."

title: Pathologist Vicki Belon
gameText: Play to change the Site Prerequisite to OCCULT INVESTIGATION 3+.
dialogue:
Scully: "What's the connection?"
Pathologist Belon: "I found no other evidence of any other tissue damage or electrical burns or any other serious trauma. It's as if God Himself struck her down."

title: Father Gregory
gameText: Adds X to one Team's SUBTERFUGE or OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill check. X = 1 for every 2 [RP] paid when playing this card.
dialogue: "Two girls are dead…not by the hand of Man. Unless you accept the truth of God's teachings, that there is a struggle between good and evil for all souls and that we are losing that struggle, you're but fools rushing in." - Father Gregory

title: Gibson Praise
gameText: Place two tokens on this card. Remove a token to look at the next three cards from the top of your Bureau Deck and return them to the top of your Bureau Deck in any order. Discard this card when the last token is removed.
dialogue: "I just hear you thinking, like on a radio. And sometimes there are lots of radios. And I want to shut them off and watch some TV." - Gibson Praise

title: Bond Mill Road, Rural Maryland
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one METHOD question.
dialogue:
Jeremiah Smith: "I can explain everything to you."
Mulder: "First I want you to come somewhere with me. I want you to come with me to see my mother."

title: Max Fenig's Trailer, Barnes Corners, NY
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one MOTIVE question.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Remember this place?"
Scully: " I remember being amazed at what some people will call home."
Mulder: "You have to admit, the man had an enduring sense of style."

title: Department of Defense, Washington, D.C.
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one MOTIVE question.
dialogue: "The man who lay dead in my apartment worked for the Department of Defense at its Advanced Research facility. What I might find here, I was uncertain of. But my crime had provided me access." - Mulder

title: Fells Point Industrial Park, Baltimore, MD
question: You may ask one METHOD question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "What I'm looking at here is a warehouse break - in with nothing stolen, a shoot - out but no guns, lots of blood but no bodies. And an FBI Agent who likes to take off his clothes and talk about space aliens." - Detective John Munch

title: Apalachicola National Forest, Leon County, FL
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "A survey team working these woods didn't report in last night. We found one man's bloody jacket pretty torn up. And this morning, a boy got separated from his father." - Michele Fazekas

title: University of Indiana, Bloomington, IN
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "If you two will excuse me, I really don't have time for this. I have to travel tonight to the University of Ingolstadt to deliver an international address." - Dr. Pollidori

title: Pollidori Residence, Rural Indiana
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question.
dialogue:
Scully: "What are you doing?"
Mulder: "Mrs. Berkowitz said in her letter that when she saw her intruder there was a gaseous white cloud, and then when she woke up three days later nobody knew that she'd been gone."

title: Sim Residence, San Diego, CA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one METHOD question.
dialogue:
Scully: "It says here that your precinct visited the Sims before. Two weeks ago. A domestic disturbance call?"
Det. Kresge: "We sent a unit cause the neighbors were complaining. They were screaming at each other. It wasn't a happy household."

title: St. Clair Pediatric Center, San Diego, CA
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one METHOD question.
dialogue:
Scully: "In a minute a nurse is going to take you down to have some tests."
Emily Sim: "Mommy said no more tests."
Scully: "We just want you to get better."

title: Lorton Penitentiary Hospital Ward, Lorton, VA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question.
dialogue:
U.S. Marshal: "How did this man make his way out of the building?"
Skinner: "Every indication is he simply walked out the front door."

title: Coats Grove, MI
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one METHOD question. If you ask if the METHOD is "Threats", the skill check prerequisite is 4+.
dialogue: "Coats Grove authorities conducted a detailed examination of the soil and root composition in the Rich family orchard, but could not explain what pulled Karin Matthews' body into the Michigan mud." - Mulder

title: Ammas Beach, ME
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one METHOD question.
dialogue: "Mulder, I'm on vacation. The weather is clear. I'm looking forward to hitting the road and breathing in some of this fine New England air." - Scully

title: Metro Diner, Washington, D.C.
question: You may ask one RESULT question.
dialogue: "Eight unconnected dealers all at the same place at the same time, all tipped off by phone looking for somebody. Last call goes to the Marshals, They arrive, place explodes, Gelman dies in the crossfire. It's genius." - Mulder

title: Fairfax County, VA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "I've found something down in Fairfax County. A derelict chicken farm with a T3 connection, paid for by Aleph Industries, Palo Alto, of which there's no other record anywhere." - Mulder

title: Chaney, TX
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one METHOD question. If you ask if the METHOD is "Subterfuge", the skill check prerequisite is 4+.
dialogue:
Scully: "You want us to go to Dallas?"
Mulder: "Yee - haw! Actually, a town called Chaney, about 50 miles south of there, population 361. By all accounts, very rustic and charming, but as of late, ground zero the locus for a series of mysterious nocturnal exsanguinations."

title: Kazakhstan, Former Soviet Union
question: You may ask one METHOD question or one RESULT question.
dialogue:
Marita Covarrubias: "Whatever happened in Kazakhstan, there was no one left to give an accurate account."
First Elder: "How many bodies were there?"
Marita: "Forty - one, all burned beyond recognition. "

title: Ruskin Dam, PA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "Heli - Unit Four responding to Ruskin Dam. We have numerous bodies. Repeat, numerous bodies. We're coming in for a closer look. It looks like some kind of incineration has occurred here." - Helicopter Pilot

title: Wiekamp Air Force Base, WV
question: You may ask one METHOD question.
dialogue: "The mass incinerations were strikes by an alien rebellion to upset plans for occupation. Now, one of these rebels is being held captive. And if he dies, so does the resistance." - Krycek

title: Skur’s Rental House, Caledonia, WI
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one RESULT question.
dialogue:
Arthur Dales: "And now you've found him?"
Mulder: "Yes. Last week. Shot to death by a sheriff serving an eviction notice. A man was also found in his bathroom with all his soft tissue removed."

title: Wilmington, DE
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "Ms. Glenn took a $60 cab ride alone straight to the motel. The cabbie instructed her to Room #10, which she asked for specifically, and then told him to get lost. Thirty minutes later, dead heroin dealer." - Scully

title: Church of St. Peter the Sinner, VA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one METHOD question.
dialogue:
Mulder: "The Gnostic Gospels, Book of Enoch, Book of J, Apocrypha.I'm surprised there's nothing here from 'Jesus Christ Superstar'."
Scully: "What kind of church is this?"
Mulder: "There's no telling."

title: Folger Park, Washington, D.C.
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "Due to reasons that are still under review, our operation failed. Jacob Steven Haley remains at large. Whereabouts unknown." - Skinner

title: Dunbar Movie Theater, Gables Corner, OH
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one METHOD question. If you ask if the MOTIVE is "Ideology", the skill check prerequisite is 4+.
dialogue:
Scully: "They've killed again. 14 people in a movie theatre in Ohio. The same toxin they released in the park."
Mulder: "14 people? That doesn't make any sense."
Scully: "Unless it was a test…for something bigger."

title: VinylRight Telemarketing Hub, Oak Brook, IL
question: You may ask one METHOD question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "VinylRight. They make siding. Their telemarketing hub in Oakbrook was the focus of an anonymous audio - taped manifesto, one which threatened violence. Apparently, several years back they had an incident in another office – a disgruntled employee with a gun." - Skinner

title: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
question: You may ask one METHOD question.
dialogue: "Using a weapon registered to a US intelligence agency, the shooter fired one kill shot at Anatole Klebanow before being captured without incident a short distance from the scene." - Agent Spender

title:
Inget Murray Psychiatic Hospital, Gaithersburg,
MD
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question.
dialogue:
Scully: "Where'd you see that?"
Diana Fowley: Agent Mulder and I spent some time in psychiatric hospitals. There were some patients serving criminal sentences who we felt had been misdiagnosed.

title: Past Lives
gameText: Play this card after an Agent has been sent to the Discard Pile or removed from the game. For the rest of this turn, an Agent of your choice has skill values (including combat) equal to those of the discarded/removed Agent.
dialogue: "Her name is Kavanaugh. Sarah Kavanaugh. And my name...is Sullivan Biddle. She doesn't know…She doesn't know...that I'm waiting for her...that we will live again." - Mulder, under hypnosis

title: The Third Man
gameText: Attach this card to Section Chief Blevins. If you choose to contribute to the [CP] pool during the Briefing Phase, treat Blevins as a RES 3 (while he is in the Bureau Section).
dialogue:
Blevins: "You're here because we've been informed by the Department of Defense that prior to Agent Mulder's accident, you may have been notified by a DoD employee."
Scully: "Yes, that's right."
Senior Agent: "And he may have given you classified information."

title: Stonewalled
gameText: Negate any one Keyword BUREAUCRACY card.
dialogue:
The Cigarette - Smoking Man: "You've been watching Mulder. You had a man on him. No one bothered to inform me of this.
First Elder: "I know nothing about a man."
CSM: "I will not be cut out like this. You need my expertise."

title: All Lies Lead to the Truth
gameText: Play this card after a single Agent investigates a Site and a Witness contributed to the skill check. Search your Bureau Deck and add any one card to your hand. If the card has the Keyword HEALING, you may immediately play it for zero cost, ignoring Activator requirements. In addition, you may guess the identity of your opponent's X-File without incurring a penalty question.
dialogue: "As long as they believed Scully's lie, that it was me lying on that floor, I might learn truths here." - Mulder

title: Distrust
gameText: Play this card during your opponent's Case Assignment Phase. Two Agents (your choice) may not combine their skills toward any of the same skill checks this turn.
dialogue:
Scully: "This isn't your job!"
Skinner: "My job is to direct the agents under me, to question their motives when they're lying about investigations, to take steps to cease or censure their actions. Your lie is on record, Agent Scully."
Scully: "And what about yours?"

title: Tools of Science
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword SCIENCES cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "If my work with Agent Mulder has tested the foundation of my beliefs, science has been and continues to be my guiding light. Now I'm again relying on its familiar and systematic methods to arrive at a truth, a fact that might explain the fate that has befallen me." - Scully

title: Deionized Water
gameText: Play this card during your opponent's Healing Phase to prevent one hospitalized Agent (your choice) from healing damage this turn. Alternately, you may play this card to negate any one Keyword HEALING card.
dialogue:
Mulder: "What? What is it?"
Byers: "It's deionized water. It's nothing more than that."

title: Transferred to ICU
gameText: Play this card on an Agent that is about to be moved to the Hospital. Unless the Agent has an "escort", you may choose to add any one afflicting Keyword (i.e. CANCER, INSANITY, ABDUCTEE) to the Agent. The Keyword remains until a Healing card is played on the Agent.
dialogue:
Skinner: "She went into hypovolemic shock. She's lost a lot of blood."
Mulder: "Due to what? Due to what?!"
Skinner: "She's dying."

title: A Beckoning Offer
gameText: Play this card to gain one of the following effects: Place this card in your Bureau to prevent your opponent from exchanging pools while this card is in play, or place this card on one Agent to allow that Agent to contribute their RES to the [CP] pool instead of the [RP] pool.
dialogue: "As I said, I'm offering you a chance to know the truth." - The Cigarette - Smoking Man

title: Bedside Vigil
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent in either the Bureau or the Field. As long as this card is in play, the Agent may generate RES as normal, even while in the Hospital. In addition, the Agent is immune to any card that affects their RES (i.e. “Sinus Cavity Implant”, “Blight”).
dialogue:
Scully: "What are you doing here? You have a hearing."
Mulder: "Yeah. I came by last night but I didn't have the heart to wake you."

title: Section Chief Blevins Dead In Apparent Suicide
gameText: If your opponent includes Section Chief Scott Blevins in any skill check in the Bureau, Blevins is instantly killed and removed from the game.
dialogue: "Blevins had been on payroll for four years to a biotechnology company called Roush, which is somehow connected to all this." - Skinner

title: The Cigarette-Smoking Man Extinguished
gameText: Negate one GOVERNMENT or MASTER Adversary played against your Team. In addition, if the Team makes a SUBTERFUGE skill check 6+, they may ask either one METHOD or one RESULT question.
dialogue:
Skinner: "The Smoking Man's dead."
Mulder: "How?"
Skinner: "Shot through his window. No body was found but there was too much blood loss for anyone to have survived."

title: Welcome to Hackland
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword COMPUTER cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "It was in that capacity that I was attending the Computer and Electronics Show at the Baltimore Convention Center. It was where this whole thing started, just this morning." - Byers

title: Hack Into Government Agencies
gameText: Play this card to search through your Bureau Deck. Select any one Keyword EXPENDITURE card and attach it to an Agent with a COMPUTER skill value of 1+ at no cost. Shuffle your deck.
dialogue: "Government hack is a snap. Last week I got into the Maryland DMV. Changed my endorsement so I can handicap park…I got tinnitus." - Langly

title: Team-Building Retreat
gameText: Place this card in your Bureau section. As long as this card is in play, Agents with an attached TRAINING card gain each skill modifier listed on the card instead of only one.
dialogue:
Agent Stonecypher: "Have you ever been to a team seminar, Agent Mulder?"
Mulder: "No, unfortunately around this time of year I always develop a severe hemorrhoidal condition."

title: AD NOCTVM
gameText: Play this card after one of your Adversaries is negated or defeated in combat. Place the Adversary beneath this card. Beginning on your opponent's next turn, discard this card to choose either to play the Adversary for free or ignore Activator requirements to play it.
dialogue: "It means 'into darkness'. The Spanish Conquistadors used to carve it on the posts that they would lash the natives to as a warning." - Mulder

title: Extra-Crunchy Evidence
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword EVIDENCE COLLECTION cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "I think we found our smoking gun." - Mulder, regarding the empty jar of peanut butter discovered in the trash

title: Digging Up the Past
gameText: Shuffle your Discard Pile, then exchange your Discard Pile with your Bureau Deck. Your Bureau Deck becomes the Discard Pile.
dialogue: "I need the complete case files on my sister, Melissa Scully. Yeah, crime scene and autopsy along with the PCR's that we ran...Right, but I need you to send them to the San Diego Field Office...As soon as possible...Okay. Thanks, Danny." - Scully

title: Emily Sim
gameText: Attach this card to a Witness RESOURCE. If at any time the Witness is discarded or removed from the game, place this card on Agent Scully to add the following modifiers to her skills:+1 BEHAVIORAL, +2 ALIEN INVESTIGATION, +1 HEALTH. In addition, Scully may not be afflicted with the Keyword CANCER.
dialogue: "According to this...I am Emily's mother." - Scully

title: FBI Courier
gameText: Play this card during the Requisition Phase to assign one Equipment card with a BUREAU Activator to an Agent in the Field.
dialogue: "No, no. I need Agent Scully's signature, sir…Sorry, ma'am. They make you sign for everything these days. Merry Christmas." - FBI Courier

title: Little Box of Sand
gameText: Play this card to destroy one Keyword RESOURCE card with a CONSPIRACY Activator. This card is free if the "Symbol of Faith" is equipped to one of your Agents.
dialogue:
Scully: "Who are the men who would create a life whose only hope was to die?"
Mulder: "I don't know. But the fact that you found her, and had a chance to love her…then maybe she was meant for that, too."
Scully: "She found me."

title: Blue Man Goop
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "I'm going to take a wild stab here and guess this is a clue." - Mulder

title: Contact Your Local Authorities
gameText: Play this card during the Deployment Phase to search through your Bureau Deck and select an Agent with the Keywords INDEPENDENT and LAW. Add this Agent to your team of Agents at half-cost (rounded up). Discard this card along with the Agent at the end of this turn or if the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to zero.
dialogue: "Get me the Falls Church P.D." - Skinner

title: Blight
gameText: Play this card at the start of your opponent's Briefing Phase. Opposing Agents in the Field section of the table generate no RES this turn.
dialogue: "They're all dying. According to Bobby's mother, that's a big reason why her husband blew up. His hazelnut orchard was hit with a blight." - Scully

title: Psychotherapy
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword BEHAVIORAL cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "My approach is with the victims solely, to allow them to empower themselves." - Karin Matthews

title: Rumors of Witchcraft
gameText: Search your Bureau Deck and choose any one Keyword OCCULT INVESTIGATION or OCCULT card. Show the card to your opponent, add it to your hand, and shuffle your Bureau Deck.
dialogue: "Oh, please. Melissa Turner. That whore's a witch sure as I'm standing here. She's descended from the Hawthornes in Salem and the Englishes, too." - Jane Froelich

title: Interagency Luncheon
gameText: Play on a Team at a Site that includes at least one Keyword FBI Agent and one INDEPENDENT Agent. Add 5 tokens to your [RP] Pool.
dialogue:
Scully: "Oh, my god. That looks like something out of Jules Verne. We're supposed to eat that?"
Jack Bonsaint: "A little late for anything else."

title: Kill Switch
gameText: Negates any one card played against your Team during a COMPUTER or EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill check.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Well, we have this. 'Twilight Time'."
Esther Nairn: "That's it. That's the Kill Switch."

title: The Rashomon Effect
gameText: While this card is in play, two identical Sites may be played during the Case Assignment Phase. The Team may investigate both Sites this turn. Resolve each Site individually.
dialogue:
Mulder: "I'm going to tell Skinner exactly what I saw. What are you going to tell him?"
Scully: "I'll tell him exactly what I saw."
Mulder: "Now, how is that different?"

title: Coroner's Inquest
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword MEDICAL cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "Case 0026198, Ronald Lavelle Strickland. Probable cause of death...Gee, that's a tough one." - Coroner

title: UFO Conference
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword ALIEN INVESTIGATION cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "All this conjecture - the 'ontological shock' that you speak of, for which we are so ill - equipped - is not only false but dangerous." - Mulder

title: Malchik
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent in the section of the table designated The Gulag. Place two additional tokens of imprisonment on the Agent. The Agent must remain in The Gulag until all tokens are removed and cannot be freed using ESCAPE cards. This card is discarded when the last token is removed. The Agent is moved to the Bureau and permanently loses one HEALTH.
dialogue:
Gulag Commandant: "What did the boy say about this?"
Guard: "I don't know. Only Krycek knows. He interrogated him, beat him. Then he ordered the test."

title: Staged Abductions
gameText: Search your Bureau Deck and choose any one Keyword ABDUCTION or ABDUCTEE card (Treat "Abduction" and "Alien Harvester" as a Keyword ABDUCTION card). Show the chosen card to your opponent, add it to your hand, and shuffle your Bureau Deck.
dialogue:
The Well - Manicured Man: "In the final phases before it begins, there will most likely be assemblies."
Second Elder: "We're years away from that."
First Elder: "If we're to believe their timetable."

title: Bargaining Chip
gameText: Attach this card to a NEUTRAL Agent. While the Agent is involved in a Site skill check, opposing players may not play any Keyword ALIEN or GOVERNMENT cards (except for cards that would negate this card). This card remains in play until your opponent moves 5 [CP] from their [CP] pool to your [RP] pool.
dialogue:
Krycek: "I'll take everything you got."
The Well - Manicured Man: "In exchange for?"
Krycek: "The boy."

title: Familiar Places
gameText: Show this card to your opponent to retrieve all Sites from your Discard Pile. Shuffle them back into your Bureau Deck and discard this card.
bio: "Mulder, why are you tiptoeing around the obvious fact here? I mean, this is Skyland Mountain. We're right back here on Skyland Mountain.” - Scully

title: Les Saboteurs
gameText: Play after a Team containing a NEUTRAL Agent successfully investigates a Site and "Bargaining Chip" is attached to the Agent. Discard this card to guess the identity of your opponent's X-File without incurring a penalty question.
dialogue:
Krycek: "They give me what I want...I'm going to rule the world."
Marita Covarrubias: "We've got them on their knees, Alex."

title: Summoned by the Stars
gameText: Place this card on an opposing Agent in the Field to change one Keyword LAW or INDEPENDENT to ABDUCTEE. Unless this card is immediately negated, it can only be removed when a Healing card is played on the afflicted Agent.
dialogue: "You're feeling it, too, aren't you?...Here. You wake up at night knowing you need to be somewhere, but you don't know where it is. Like you forgot an appointment you didn't know you had." - Cassandra Spender

title: Bridge of Sighs
gameText: Agents in all sections of the table with the Keyword ABDUCTEE are placed ten cards down, face up, in the owning player's Bureau Deck. Any cards attached to the Agent are discarded. When each Agent card reaches the top of the deck, the Agent is immediately moved to the Hospital with one token of damage.
dialogue: "I will be summoned to a place, just like Duane Barry." - Cassandra Spender

title: The Red Letter
gameText: Place this card next to your X-File. Once, during each of your opponents' Briefing Phases, you may examine the top card of your Bureau Deck. You may choose to discard the card or return it to the top of the Bureau Deck.
dialogue: "Thanks, mister. I'll mail it right off." - Young Boy

title: Prophet Ascending
gameText: Play this card on a Witness during your opponent's Investigation Phase. The Witness is placed ten cards down, face up, in the owning player's Bureau Deck. While this card is in play, ALIEN Adversaries may ignore Activator requirements to attack Agents at a Site. When the Witness card reaches the top of the deck, it is immediately added to the owning player's hand and this card is discarded.
dialogue:
Dr. Heitz Werber: "Where's Cassandra?"
Scully: "They're...they're taking her!"

title: Resist or Serve
gameText: Place this card next to your X-File. Add 5 [CP] to your pool every time you, as the Directed Player, play one Keyword GOVERNMENT card and one Keyword ALIEN card at the same Site.
dialogue:
First Elder: "We must survive first. Survival means collaboration."
The Well - Manicured Man: "Turn over the alien rebel, and you turn over any chance of resistance."
First Elder: "It's already been done."

title: Influential Patron
gameText: Play this card on any Agent with a BUREAUCRACY skill of 1+. Change one of the Agent's starting Keywords to any other one Keyword. This effect lasts until the end of the turn.
dialogue:
Skinner: "It seems you have a patron outside this office who thinks highly of you."
Agent Spender: "Who's that?"
Skinner: " I don't know. Someone working with a high level of influence."

title: Dales Tells His Tales
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword BUREAUCRACY cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue:
Mulder: "The coroner wasn't able to determine how."
Arthur Dales: "Oh, I can tell you...how. What I can't tell you...is why."

title: Xenotransplantation
gameText: This card is free if played on an Agent with the Keyword TRAITOR. Attach this card to an Agent in the Hospital. If the Agent contributes to a skill check as part of a Team, one fellow Agent on the Team (your choice) receives two tokens of damage. This occurs once per skill check until this card is removed. HEALING cards will negate this card.
dialogue: "According to VA Records, your husband underwent surgery for war injuries. So did two other men that he worked with at the state department, but the surgeries that they received... It wasn't what they thought it was." - Arthur Dales

title: Hoover Justifies the Conspiracy
gameText: Play this card to immediately force any Agents with the Keyword TRAITOR back to the Bureau. The Agent(s) may not contribute to any skill checks this turn.
dialogue: "The threat of global communist domination is a reality that can be ignored only at the risk of our own annihilation." - FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover

title: Your Suspect is Blind
gameText: Negate any one Keyword OBSERVATION card.
dialogue:
Det. Pennock: "Marty Glenn, 28. We found her at the scene doing a Formula 409. Under normal circumstances my department would have her dead to rights. There's just one little snag."
Mulder: "She's been blind since birth."

title: Dark Visions
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword OBSERVATION cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue:
Mulder: "I think that during that time, as you lost one sense, you gained another. That somehow...a connection was formed between you and your mother's killer."
Marty Glenn: "What connection?"
Mulder: "You see through his eyes."

title: Spiritual Consult
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent along with 1 [RP]. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword OCCULT INVESTIGATION cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your Briefing Phase.
dialogue:
Scully: "I've seen things. Things that have made me question if there aren't…larger forces at work here."
Father McCue: "What have you seen?"
Scully: "Visions…of my daughter Emily, for one."

title: Faces of the Seraphim
gameText: Negate any one Keyword OCCULT or Keyword OCCULT INVESTIGATION card.
dialogue: "To look upon the Seraphim in all his glory is to give up one's soul to heaven." - Father McCue

title: Deep-Cover Assignment
gameText: Play on an Agent with a SUBTERFUGE skill of 1+ and place two tokens on this card. While in play, Teams containing the Agent may not be affected by Keyword PRIMORDIAL cards and your opponent must play with all PRIMORDIAL cards in his hand face-up on the table. Remove a token during each of your Debriefing Phases. Discard this resource when the last token is removed.
dialogue: "The council we sat in was a front to make the New Spartans believe we were unaware of Agent Mulder's complicity." - Skinner

title: Lies Within Lies
gameText: Force an opponent player to reveal any Bluff cards in their hand. If your opponent has one or more, discard one at random.
dialogue:
Skinner: "What are you saying?"
Scully: "What I'm saying is that the bioweapons program may have continued in secret and that someone may be sending Agent Mulder on a suicide mission."

title: August Bremer
gameText: Negate any one Keyword CRIMINAL or Keyword CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION card.
dialogue:
August Bremer: "There's a car for you just over the rise. Head south 'till you get to the highway."
Mulder: "Who are you?"
Bremer: "Go on. If they come out here and find us, they'll kill us both."

title: Shared Madness
gameText: Play this card after a CREATURE Adversary is resolved at a Site. All BELIEVER Agents at the Site are afflicted with the Keyword INSANITY until a HEALING card is played on them. In addition, they are immediately moved to the Hospital (undamaged) and may not contribute their skills for the remainder of the turn.
dialogue:
Scully: "He was mentally ill. This monster was a sick fantasy. A product of his dementia."
Mulder: "I saw it, too."

title: Fit for Duty
gameText: Play on a Team in the Field or Bureau. If the Team makes a BEHAVIORAL 4+ skill check, the afflicted Keyword INSANITY is removed from all Agents on the Team. Alternately, this card may be played on an injured Agent to immediately heal up to two tokens of damage.
dialogue:
Skinner: "Do I infer correctly from this that you believe there's some…merit to Agent Mulder's claims?"
Scully: "I believe that Agent Mulder is mentally sound and fit for duty."

title: The Syndicate's Dilemma
gameText: Play this card during the same turn that your opponent plays a Witness RESOURCE. For the remainder of this turn, all Keyword GOVERNMENT cards may be played at half-cost (rounded up).
dialogue:
Third Elder: "The boy is a problem to us."
The Cigarette - Smoking Man: "What would you like me to do? Shoot him dead? Splatter his brains?"

title: No Secrets Here
gameText: Place this card on a Site during your Case Assignment Phase (before Bluffs have been assigned). The Directed Player must play all cards face-up at this Site. Bluffs played at this Site must be purchased at full cost.
dialogue:
The Well - Manicured Man: "There's nothing to be afraid of."
Gibson Praise: "You're a liar."

title: The B.A.T.F. Refuses to Play Ball
gameText: Play this card to prevent all Keyword INDEPENDENT Agents from contributing to any skill checks occurring at this Site, including combat.
dialogue: "No, I will not remove our people. We're close to finding the weapons." - B.A.T.F. Agent Harbaugh

title: Major General Bloch
gameText: The cost of any Keyword GOVERNMENT or PRIMORDIAL Adversaries played at this Site is reduced by 1 for each Adversary in your Discard Pile.
dialogue: "How are you so convinced that General Bloch was his next target?" - Scully

title: Hail to the Section Chief
gameText: Force all Agents with a BUREAUCRACY or MEDICAL skill at this Site back to the Bureau immediately. The Agent(s) may not contribute to any skill checks this turn.
dialogue: "Section Chief Blevins wants you in for questioning on this. He believes you have information you haven't come forward with." - Skinner

title: Bogus Revelation
gameText: Play this card to change the Site Prerequisite from ALIEN INVESTIGATION to SUBTERFUGE.
dialogue: "You've heard the recent denials about Roswell by the military and the CIA. What's been the effect? Even wilder and more widespread belief." - Michael Kritschgau

title: Chemically-Induced Paranoia
gameText: Force all opposing Agents with the Keyword INSANITY to immediately go to the Hospital (undamaged). The afflicted Agent(s) may not contribute to any skill checks this turn.
dialogue: "Yeah well, Special Agent...Mulder is currently being held under five - point restraints and jabbering like a monkey." - Detective Munch

title: Shootout at the E-H Corral
gameText: One Agent (your choice) receives damage equal to their LRC value and is afflicted with the Keyword INSANITY. The afflicted Keyword remains until a HEALING card is played on the Agent. This card is free if you discard a GOVERNMENT Adversary from your hand.
dialogue:
Langly: "Ergotamine…?"
Susanne Modeski: "E - H for short. It's an aerosolized gas which in small doses caused anxiety paranoia in its subject."

title: Human Encroachment
gameText: Play to increase any one COMPUTER, EVIDENCE COLLECTION, or OBSERVATION Site Prerequisite by 2. While this effect is in play, the Adversary "Primitive Culling" may ignore Activator requirements to attack Agents at this Site.
dialogue: "Let's shoot this next one real carefully, Marty, 'cause this is where they're gonna put the Blockbuster." - Sloan

title: Mad Scientist
gameText: Play this card to gain one of the following effects: Change the Site Prerequisite to SCIENCES 3+, negate one Keyword SCIENCES card, or increase the cost of all [RP] cards played at this Site by 3.
dialogue: "Consider relativity, the double helix, and now the Homeotic Hox gene, for which I will undoubtedly have my place among the Columbuses of science as a visionary leader of men." - Dr. Pollidori

title: Compliments of J.J.
gameText: If the Team investigating this Site negates a Keyword CREATURE Adversary when no combat was involved, each Agent on the Team takes one point of damage.
dialogue:
Mulder: "I - I'd just like some coffee, thanks."
Waitress: "On the house. Compliments of J.J."
J.J.: "That's with two Js."

title: Dr. Calderon
gameText: Play this card to increase any one BUREAUCRACY, CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION, or MEDICAL Site Prerequisite by 2. While this effect is in play, the Adversary "Stiletto For Hire" may ignore Activator requirements to attack Agents at this Site.
dialogue: "Emily suffers from a rare form of autoimmune hemolytic anemia. She's a very sick little girl." - Dr. Calderon

title: Brotherly Disapproval
gameText: Play to prevent one SKEPTIC Agent from combining their skills with any Keyword BELIEVER Agents. Your opponent may choose whether the target Agent or the BELIEVER Agents will contribute to the Site skill check (and any other skill checks occurring at this Site). This card is free if played on Agent Dana Scully.
dialogue: "They're ready for you." - William "Bill" Scully, Jr to Mulder

title: Talismanic Forces
gameText: Play this card to increase any one BEHAVIORAL, OCCULT INVESTIGATION, or SUBTERFUGE Site Prerequisite by 2. While this effect is in play, the Adversary "Chinga's Play" may ignore Activator requirements to attack Agents at this Site.
dialogue: "We're going home, Polly. Please, don't do this to Mommy!" - Melissa Turner

title: Donald Gelman
gameText: Play to change a Site Prerequisite to COMPUTER 3+.
dialogue: "Donald wrote an interlocked sequence of viruses fifteen years ago. It got loose on the net." - Esther Nairn

title: Instant Message From Beyond
gameText: Play to increase the Site Prerequisite by one point for each Agent on the Team with a COMPUTER skill value.
dialogue: "Mulder, are you telling me that Esther may have...that she may not be dead?" - Scully

title: Skyland Massacre
gameText: Agents at this Site with an ALIEN INVESTIGATION or OBSERVATION skill are afflicted with the Keyword ABDUCTEE and receive two points of damage. In addition, ALIEN Adversaries may ignore Activator requirements to attack Agents at this Site. Healing cards will remove the afflicted Keyword.
dialogue:
Scully: "Most of the dead are congregated in a wooded area a short distance off the road."
Mulder: "Self - immolation?"

title: Alien Disguise
gameText: Any Adversaries played at this Site may use MARTIAL ARTS or SUBTERFUGE Combat cards.
dialogue: "I'm talking planned invasion. The colonization of this planet by an extraterrestrial race." - Krycek

title: Security Checkpoint
gameText: Play this card to prevent all Agents without a SUBTERFUGE skill value from contributing to any skill checks occurring at this Site.
dialogue: "Due to the nature of our facility and the hazardous chemicals on site, I can only allow precleared civilians and military personnel on base." - Checkpoint M.P.

title: Mummified Corpse
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent at this Site. The Agent receives one point of damage each time your opponent uses anything other than their Resource Pool to pay for cards. This card is removed when your opponent identifies one of your X-File's characteristics.
dialogue: "Skur killed this man the way he did all the others. All the soft tissue, internal organs, ligature - all were removed...without tearing the skin." - Arthur Dales

title: Communist Calling Card
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent at the Site. The Agent is afflicted with the Keyword TRAITOR and may only contribute to SUBTERFUGE and COMBAT skill checks until this card is removed. Discard this card when the Agent is part of a Team that successfully investigates a Site.
dialogue:
Edward Skur: "You planted that."
Agent Hayes Michel: "I'll plant one in your keister, Bolshevik, you don't watch your mouth!"

title: Courage in a Bottle
gameText: Decrease all of the skill levels on one Agent (your choice) by 2 for this turn only.
dialogue:
Agent Hayes Michel: "You had a few. You were feeling bad about what happened. It's understandable."
Arthur Dales: "I...I didn't have that much to drink."

title: Roy Cohn
gameText: Increase a Site Prerequisite by one point for each Agent without a BUREAUCRACY skill. In addition, if the Team fails the Site skill check, your opponent must randomly discard one ACTIVE card from their hand.
dialogue:
Roy Cohn: "You wanna see your name on a list? Are you now, or have you ever been...?"
Arthur Dales: "What are you talking about? I'm no communist."

title: The Fallen Ones
gameText: Force an opponent to remove one Keyword MYSTIC card from the game.
dialogue: "They're deformed, tormented. So the Lord sends the Seraphim to Earth to bring back the souls of the Nephilim to keep the Devil from claiming them as his own." - Father McCue

title: Armed Robbery
gameText: If no Agents at this Site have a Keyword WEAPON equipped, you may take up to 3 [RP] from your opponent's Resource Pool and add them to your Conspiracy Pool.
dialogue: "Step away from the counter! Open the doors! Put your hands up on the windows now! Now! Do it! Get down!" - Jacob Steven Haley

title: Biotoxin on the Money
gameText: Play this card to apply X tokens of damage to Agents at this Site. X = the number of [RP] spent at this Site by the Investigating Player. The Directed Player decides how to allocate the damage.
dialogue:
Mulder: "The bank heist was a decoy. To contaminate the money you didn't take.
August Bremer: No more tests, Mr. Mulder. This is the real deal.

title: Dial and Smile
gameText: Play to change one Keyword CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION, COMPUTER, or SUBTERFUGE card to Keyword METHOD.
dialogue:
Greg Pincus (over intercom): "Nancy Aaronson, come to my office, please."
Nancy: "Uh - oh. Now I did it."

title: Checkmate
gameText: Force your opponent to discard one Keyword RESOURCE card in play. If the RESOURCE card is attached to an Agent at the Site, the Agent is immediately moved to the Hospital with zero HEALTH.
dialogue: "They killed a U.S. Marshal and then shot Agent Fowley. They worked on her here for an hour." - Skinner

title: Five-Alarm Fire
gameText: If the Team fails the Site skill check, your opponent must discard all cards in their hand and the turn ends immediately.
dialogue: "Mulder, whatever you may believe, this time they may have won." - Scully

title: Subcutaneous Implant
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent in the Hospital. Afflicted Keywords (i.e. CANCER, INSANITY) may not be applied to the Agent while this card is equipped. The Agent is also immune to the "Sinus Cavity Implant".
dialogue:
Frohike: "This is a cure for cancer?"
Mulder: "It may be for Scully's."

title: FCC Button
gameText: Adds 1 to the Agent's BUREAUCRACY skill. This card is free if the assigned Agent has the Keyword INFORMATION.
dialogue:
Byers: "Hi, guys! Like a button?"
Hacker Dude: "Up yours, narc."

title: Forward Looking InfraRed
gameText: The attached Agent may apply their LONG RANGE COMBAT value to any Adversary in which the LRC round is skipped. Each player may only have one of this card in their decks.
dialogue: "It was developed by chopper pilots in Vietnam. Detects body heat at 300 yards." - Jeff Glaser

title: Gas Mask
gameText: Adds 2 to the Agent's MEDICAL skill. Additionally, the Agent is immune to the "poisonous blood" of ALIEN Adversaries.
dialogue: "I told you there ain't no monster." - Old Man Pollidori

title: Sunflower Seeds
gameText: Adds 2 to the Agent's HEALTH. Discard this card to negate one OCCULT CREATURE.
dialogue: "Historically, certain types of seeds were thought to fascinate vampires. Chiefly oats and millet, but you make do with what you have." - Mulder

title: Wooden Stake
gameText: Attach this card to a Keyword BELIEVER Agent. Any OCCULT Adversary damaged by this weapon in CRC is discarded prior to dealing damage in the CRC round.
dialogue:
Scully: "I'm in this as deep as you are and I'm not even the one that overreacted. I didn't do the...with the thing."
Mulder: "I did not overreact. Ronnie Strickland was a vampire."

title: Garlic Breadsticks
gameText: Attach this card to a Keyword BELIEVER Agent. Subtract two points from each damaging hit caused by OCCULT Adversaries. In addition, the Agent may attack "Vampire" Adversaries in the LONG RANGE COMBAT round.
dialogue: "Back! Ahh…No!" - Mulder

title: Uroff-Koltoff Star of Russia
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent in the Field. Discard this card to allow the attached Agent to investigate two Sites in different states or countries in one turn.
dialogue: "This ship is bound back to Vladivostok tomorrow. I gather there'll be quite an enthusiastic homecoming." - The Well - Manicured Man

title: Monster Mask
gameText: Attach this card to a Keyword LAW Agent. PRIMORDIAL Adversaries may not assign damage to this Agent unless there are no other eligible targets. Discard this card to prevent one point of damage by any non-PHENOMENA Adversary.
dialogue: "We have a job to do. You're Dracula." - August Bremer

title: Intruder Alarm
gameText: Discard this card during the Case Assignment Phase to force your opponent to reveal all Adversaries in their hand. If any Adversaries are revealed, you may draw one Combat card from your Bureau Deck and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
dialogue: "Obviously, you underestimated me. More obviously, you overestimated the man you sent to do the job." - The Cigarette - Smoking Man

title: Divide and Conquer
gameText: Play this card on an EVOLUTIONARY or PRIMORDIAL Adversary. During this round, the Adversary's CLOSE RANGE COMBAT skill is increased by 2 and only the Agent with the highest current HEALTH (your choice if there is a tie) inflicts and receives damage.
dialogue: "I think what we stumbled upon here is something more than what local authorities realize. The scenario described by that boy sounds to me like a primitive culling technique." - Mulder

title: Ammo Depleted
gameText: Play this card when an opposing combatant uses an Equipment card to modify a skill check during Combat. The Equipment is discarded and has no effect.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Is that your only clip?"
Scully: "Yep."
Mulder: "Don't fire again unless you're sure you're gonna hit it. It may be trying to spend our advantage."

title: Take My Weapon!
gameText: Play this card when an Agent is forced to participate in Combat without the rest of their Team. The target Agent may immediately receive one Equipment card from another Agent in their Team. Unless it is discarded, return the borrowed card to the owning Agent when Combat ends.
dialogue:
Scully: "I'm not alone. I don't have my weapon. Mulder?!"
Mulder: "Hold on, I'm going to drop my gun down."

title: Seeds of Diversion
gameText: Play this card to negate the CLOSE RANGE COMBAT attack of any OCCULT or EVOLUTIONARY Adversary this round.
dialogue: "Yeah, you toss a handful of seeds at one, no matter what he's doing he's got to stop and pick it up." - Mulder

title: Incendiary Strike
gameText: Play this card on any ALIEN Adversary to add 2 to their CLOSE RANGE COMBAT skill. Any Agent(s) wounded by this Adversary must immediately go to the Hospital (regardless of HEALTH) and may no longer participate in the Combat.
dialogue:
Marita Covarrubias: "The corpses were literally carbonized from the heat."
Second Elder: "A new weapon being tested?"

title: Extreme Interrogation
gameText: Play this card on any PRIMORDIAL Adversary to add 1 to its CLOSE RANGE COMBAT skill this round. In addition, one Agent wounded by the Adversary this round permanently loses 1 CRC.
dialogue: "I risked everything! If I was lying, there'd be federal agents descending on this place like the wrath of God right now! If you touch me again, you'd better kill me!" - Mulder
